column4: I need to know how to mount a device which shows up in /var/log/syslog as "Nov 25 17:48:42 experimental kernel: [78887.680000]  usb 2-1: new full speed USB device using uhci_hcd and address 5"
Any suggestions?
is it a pen drive?
Digital voice recorder, flash memory.
it should mount itself (if it's a usb masss storage device). to use the voice recording function, try selecting it as an alsa audio device
I don't need to use it while connected, just transfer files.  (They're recorded as wav)
doesn't it mount itself???
Doesn't look like it
when you plug in, say, a pen drive, does it mount automatically?
Yes
dunno waht to do then. sorry :( i hope someone else can fix your problem
, sladen: There is no /dev/sd* for it
it probably isnt a mass storage device, but i've had an idea - how did you access it in windoze/mac?
, sladen: Shows in 'lsusb' as Bus 002 Device 005: ID 07b4:020d Olympus Optical Co., Ltd Digital Voice Recorder VN-240PC
I didn't.  I don't have either.
:s how does it say you should trnasfer files from it in windoze/mac
, sladen: Which isn't actually the model number, but right brand
Win has an audio editor program that also handles the file transfer
was that a program which came with it? what was it?
Olympus Digital Wave Player
sladen: it might work in wine - try it
Maybe another day for that route - don't have time for Wine fiddling tonight.  If it's recognized by lsusb though, shouldn't I be able to use it natively?
i don't think it acts as a mass storage device, so it can detect it but can't drive it
Hmm
